verse_content.Sanskrit:
देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ।
ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ॥ १४ ॥
verse_content.Transliteration:
deva-dvija-guru-prājña-
pūjanaṁ śaucam ārjavam
brahmacaryam ahimsā ca
śārīram tapa ucyate
verse_content.Translation:
The austerity of the body consists in this: worship of the Supreme Lord, the
brāhmaņas, the spiritual master, and superiors like the father and mother.
Cleanliness, simplicity, celibacy and nonviolence are also austerities of the body.
verse_content.Purport:
The Supreme Godhead here explains the different kinds of austerity and
penance. First He explains the austerities and penances practiced by the body.
One should offer, or learn to offer, respect to God or to the demigods, the
perfect, qualified brāhmaṇas and the spiritual master and superiors like father,
mother or any person who is conversant with Vedic knowledge. These should
be given proper respect. One should practice cleansing oneself externally and
internally, and he should learn to become simple in behavior. He should not
do anything which is not sanctioned by the scriptural injunction. He should
not indulge in sex outside of married life, for sex is sanctioned in the scripture
only in marriage, not otherwise. This is called celibacy. These are penances
and austerities as far as the body is concerned.
